text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with walnut and parsley pesto
that's right I've never been really that
involved with this whole raw food
revolution I mean first of all I do have
a stove which I enjoy using but above
and beyond that I'm just not big on
revolutions in general hey some people
just don't look good holding a pitchfork
and a torch but anyway having said that
if I did have to pick one favorite raw
food recipe it would probably be a pesto
and I said a pesto not the pesto because
while I know you're all thinking of a
very specific pesto recipe pretty much
any flavorful raw ingredients we smashed
into a paste is a pesto for example this
amazingly delicious walnut and parsley
version I'm about to show you so let's
go ahead and get started with the most
important ingredient that's not an
ingredient and I'm talking about the
mortar and pestle okay because to make a
true pesto you have to smash your
ingredients in this and the first thing
we're gonna want to crush in this is our
garlic and we'll also add a nice big
pinch of kosher salt and we will take
our pestle and start smashing and
mashing that although I really should be
using two hands there we go but anyway
we'll continue to crush that garlic and
salt down to pretty much a paste okay
doesn't have to be perfectly fine
because it's gonna continue to get
crushed when we add the rest of the
ingredients but I do think we might have
smashed and crushed at least this far
all right so that looks good and at this
point we can move on and add our raw
walnuts yes Ron not toasted not roasted
just simply some nice fresh shelled
walnuts and we'll go ahead and we'll
smash and mash that down to pretty much
a paste which does take a couple seconds
before things start to happen but as
you'll see once they'll start to break
down they crush pretty quickly and
exactly how far you should go is up to
you okay remember you guys are the king
tut's
of how finally to crush your nuts so
personally I do like to leave them a
little coarse I do like the texture a
little better plus who wants a pound all
day so I kept crushing mine until I
achieve the texture you see right here
so kind of fine but not too fine at this
point we can add about 1/2 cup of
freshly chopped parsley and just like
the garlic I do like to give the parcels
a little chop first because I think it
makes it mix in a lot better and easier
but again that's up to you you can just
put the whole leaves in and crush them
and by the way I should mention just
because I'm using a gorgeous olive wood
and mortar and pestle those ones they
make out of stone or marble
or just as well the only kind I don't
like are those glass ones I don't really
understand those but anyway I went ahead
and pounded in that parsley until look
something like this
at which point we'll stop and add the
last few ingredients which for me is
gonna be some acidity in the form of
freshly squeezed lemon juice and then
we'll also add a little touch of
extra-virgin olive oil not too much just
a tablespoon or two and then we'll go
ahead and grab our pestle and kind of
stir mash and emulsify that in and of
course if you're thinking to yourself
man that looks like a lot of work I
would use a blender or a food processor
instead well you could but the bad news
is it will never ever taste like this
and that is a scientific fact
and besides recent fake studies have
shown the number of calories you burn
pounding this stuff is virtually
identical to the number of calories you
will gain by eating it so that's kind of
cool
but anyway we're gonna keep pounding
mixing mashing smush it in a smashing
and what should happen is you
incorporate that as the mixer is gonna
get very thick and if everything goes
according to plan you should end up with
something that looks like this which you
can use as is it's probably fine but
what I did was give it a taste and
decide to add a little more salt as well
as drizzle in a couple teaspoons of
water just to lighten up the texture a
little and you may be thinking why water
that has no flavor
because other than a little salt I
thought it was perfect so I actually
don't want to thin it with lemon juice
or vinegar or something else that has
flavor because I don't want to taste
differently and please keep in mind
water and fats don't like to mix so if
it doesn't seem to want to mix in go
ahead and use a whisk but I did get her
done with the old freakishly small
wooden spoon and once we've adjusted the
seasoning and possibly the texture our
walnut and parsley pesto is done and
ready to use on so many things including
this piece of toasted bread so let me
spread some on so I can go in for the
official taste and right here you can
get a really great look at the coarse
texture I went for and that was simply
achieved by not smashing those walnut
pieces super fine but if you do want to
spend a few extra minutes to make it
smooth go ahead it's gonna taste
basically the same so it's really more
of a mouthfeel thing and it's tempting
not to tell you what this tastes like
just so that you're so curious you have
to make it but I'm gonna tell you anyway
this looks feels and tastes almost
exactly like garlic butter I mean it
really does taste that rich and decadent
and that garlic flavor is so pure
so intense it's actually hot is in like
peppery hot in fact I'm sure you notice
this recipe with sands cayenne and
that's why and as fantastic as it is
just on a little piece of bread it would
be equally amazing on some pizza or
pasta or it could make something as
boring as roasted chicken and sweet
potato seem exciting so let's go ahead
and finish this video off by showing you
how I used up most of mine and again I
just can't get over how closely it looks
and taste the garlic butter I mean there
really is something and I'm only gonna
take one quick bite of this whoops
that's the bone there we go
but this stuff was so good I even ate
that whole prop potato just so good and
I know I gave you a few quick
suggestions for what to do with this but
this is one of those recipes where you
don't have to have any idea what you're
gonna do with it before you make it
because once this is completed and ready
to use those things will reveal
themselves as if by magic oh you'll see
so I really do hope you give this a try
